alert.note: Alert for Louisa (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 06 at 11:01PM CDT until May 07 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN LOUISA...NORTHEASTERN KEOKUK...SOUTHERN JOHNSON... NORTHERN WASHINGTON AND SOUTHEASTERN IOWA COUNTIES... At 1101 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Wellman, or 15 miles northwest of Washington, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. This severe storm will be near... Amish around 1105 PM CDT. Kalona, Richmond, Frytown and Windham around 1110 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Sharon Center, University Heights, Riverside, Iowa City Municipal Airport, Hills, Hills Access, River Junction, Johnson County Fairgrounds, University Of Iowa and Lone Tree. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
